DataElement.preferredName: Patient International Metastatic Renal Cell Carcinoma Database Consortium Criteria Risk Factor Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The numeric response for the stratification factor to address the participants International Metastatic Renal Cell Carcinoma Database Consortium (IMDC) Criteria risk score.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient International Metastatic Renal Cell Carcinoma Database Consortium Criteria Risk Score Stratification Factors
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._A validated risk prediction tool for patients with metastatic renal cell carcinoma (mRCC) receiving first-line targeted therapy. The model considers: Karnofsky performance status less than 80%, time from diagnosis to first-line targeted therapy less than 1 year, hemoglobin concentration less than lower limit of normal, neutrophil count greater than upper limit of normal, platelet count greater than upper limit of normal, and serum calcium concentration greater than upper limit of normal._The potential future harm that may arise from some present action. It is often combined or confused with the probability of an event which is seen as undesirable._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability._Selected pre-treatment factors by which patients are segregated to assure equal balance of these factors before randomization to the intervention arms of a clinical protocol.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: International Metastatic Renal Cell Carcinoma Database Consortium Criteria Risk Score Stratification Factors
Property.preferredDefinition: A validated risk prediction tool for patients with metastatic renal cell carcinoma (mRCC) receiving first-line targeted therapy. The model considers: Karnofsky performance status less than 80%, time from diagnosis to first-line targeted therapy less than 1 year, hemoglobin concentration less than lower limit of normal, neutrophil count greater than upper limit of normal, platelet count greater than upper limit of normal, and serum calcium concentration greater than upper limit of normal.:The potential future harm that may arise from some present action. It is often combined or confused with the probability of an event which is seen as undesirable.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.:Selected pre-treatment factors by which patients are segregated to assure equal balance of these factors before randomization to the intervention arms of a clinical protocol.

Concepts.longName: International Metastatic Renal Cell Carcinoma Database Consortium Criteria
Concepts.definition: A validated risk prediction tool for patients with metastatic renal cell carcinoma (mRCC) receiving first-line targeted therapy. The model considers: Karnofsky performance status less than 80%, time from diagnosis to first-line targeted therapy less than 1 year, hemoglobin concentration less than lower limit of normal, neutrophil count greater than upper limit of normal, platelet count greater than upper limit of normal, and serum calcium concentration greater than upper limit of normal.
The potential future harm that may arise from some present action. It is often combined or confused with the probability of an event which is seen as undesirable.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.
Selected pre-treatment factors by which patients are segregated to assure equal balance of these factors before randomization to the intervention arms of a clinical protocol.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the management of a research protocol and its case report forms.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Any aspect of an individual's life, behavior, an environmental exposure, or an inborn or inherited characteristic that increases the likelihood of a disease, condition or injury._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A mathematical element that when added to another number yields the same number; the cardinal number meaning one less than one.

Concepts.definition: A mathematical element that when added to another number yields the same number; the cardinal number meaning one less than one.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object._Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement._A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one.

Concepts.definition: The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Something that increases the chance of developing a disease. Some examples of risk factors for cancer are age, a family history of certain cancers, use of tobacco products, being exposed to radiation or certain chemicals, infection with certain viruses or bacteria, and certain genetic changes.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: Any aspect of an individual's life, behavior, an environmental exposure, or an inborn or inherited characteristic that increases the likelihood of a disease, condition or injury.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.
